DOC.brief_summary: This randomize clinical trial study computerize cognitive retrain improve cognitive function breast cancer survivor . Cancer-related cognitive deficit , think memory issue , common among breast cancer survivor . The severity cognitive deficit associate significant negative impact daily function quality life . A computerized cognitive retrain method may help researcher find way improve cognitive function quality life breast cancer survivor .
DOC.brief_title: Computerized Cognitive Retraining Improving Cognitive Function Breast Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Evaluate feasibility acceptability 6-week computerized work memory train program breast cancer survivor subjectively report cognitive deficit : evaluate feasibility study procedure ( recruitment screening procedure , number participant recruit , screen , retain , attrition rate reason , weekly phone call complete participant ) ; evaluate acceptability adaptive computerized work memory training intervention ( burden , adherence training schedule , performance level achieve , participant satisfaction computerize exercise ) . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To evaluate difference posttest mean T2 ( week # 7 ) adjust T1 ( baseline ) primary work memory outcomes visuo-spatial work memory ( VSWM ) , visual work memory ( VWM ) , executive function ( EF ) measure neuropsychological test ( Rey Auditory Test , Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale [ WAIS ] IV symbol test , WAIS IV cod test , Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System [ DKFES ] color test , Trails A Trails B test , WAIS IV Letter Number sequence test ) self-report Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System ( PROMIS ) survey ( Applied Cognition General Concerns Short Form , Applied Cognition Executive Function Short Form , Functional Assessment Cancer Therapy [ FACT ] Cognitive Function ) intervention group wait control group . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I ( COMPUTER-ASSISTED COGNITIVE TRAINING ) : Patients complete computerized work memory training program ( Cogmed ) 35 minute day , 5 time week 6 week . ARM II ( WAIT LIST ) : Patients undergo standard follow-up care 6 week . Following standard follow-up care , patient may complete Cogmed Intervention Group week 7-13 .
DOC.criteria: Breast cancer ( stage 0 , I , II , III ) , 18 month 5 year post oncologic therapy surgery , chemotherapy , and/or radiation therapy ( exclude current selective estrogen receptor modulators aromatase inhibitor ) Able read , write , speak English Mini Mental State Exam score great equal 19 Have reliable internet daily access computer audio/speakers Agree travel Seattle Cancer Care Alliance ( SCCA ) University Washington ( UW ) School Nursing 23 person assessment 1213 week study History multiple cancer History central nervous system ( CNS ) disease , CNS radiation , intrathecal therapy , CNS surgery History traumatic brain injury Neurologic disorder stroke , encephalitis , dementia , epilepsy , Alzheimer 's disease , Parkinson 's disease Selfreport learn disability Substance addiction Diagnosis psychiatric disorder psychosis , schizophrenia , bipolar disorder Mini mental state exam score less 19 Previous participation cognitive training program Visual impairment uncorrected vision color blindness Uncorrected hear impairment Selfreport pregnant planning become pregnant next four month Anticipate move region next 4 month Inability use mouse computer key navigate around computer screen
